ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Level 22 woes (or why Unrest STILL sucks)  LONG
ygData.msgSnippet: I have also found unrest to be a great place for exp. The key is finding ppl who  know how to play or who listen.  With a good group of lvl 18-19s I can pull
ygData.messageBody:
I have also found unrest to be a great place for exp. The key is finding ppl who know how to play or who
listen. With a good group of lvl 18-19s I can pull from the second floor. I can usually come back with a
single CG or monk or even a barbed. If I pull 2 we are still ok. If I run into a train and pull a bunch
more than I expect, I just equip the drum, shout, and head to the zone. What you need to do is determine
if you have too much on you and break BEFORE you are in trouble.
I might train to zone once an evening, and I die much more rarely.




kim@... wrote:

> From: <kim@...>
>
> On Mon, 6 Mar 2000, Stephen E. McCloskey wrote:
> >
> > Gotta agree, get out of Unrest. I have a 23 bard that is stuck at 23 and 2
> > bubbles in Unrest. I have been in Unrest for two weeks now and only gained
> > half a bubble. I die at least once a night, usually due to bone-heads in
> > the group.
>
> Hmm. I spent levels 20-25 in Unrest and gained about 3-4
> bubbles a night (granted this was long ago, but it was still
> crowded with about 60-80 people there). Maybe I was fortunate
> in not ending up grouped with boneheads. I never /shouted
> "bard looking for a group." I always found people I knew that
> were there, and asked if they had room in their groups.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
